com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset

Class LightX

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset.LightX

  • public final class LightX
extends Object
    The LightX class implements Avnera's LightX Protocol and is used to facilitate communication between an Android device and hardware utilizing Avnera's LightX chip.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  LightX.Delegate
      The LightX.Delegate interface defines methods that will be called from a LightX instance to inform an interested object (typically the entity that creates the LightX class) of changes to the LightX instance's state.
      static class  LightX.FirmwareRegion
      For firmware read and write calls, a FirmwareRegion defines the region to access.
      static class  LightX.FirmwareWriteOperation
      During the firmware write operation, the LightX delegate will be called back via the lightXFirmwareUpdateProgress() callback and passed a FirmwareWriteOperation to indicate the current firmware write operation.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int kApplicationSize
      kApplicationSize is the maximum number of bytes that may be written to the application flash region.
      static int kResourceSize
      kResourceSize is the maximum number of bytes that may be written to the resource flash region.
      static boolean sEnablePacketDumps
      When true, sEnablePacketDumps will cause packet data contents to be written to the debug log in hexadecimal format.

    • Field Detail

      • sEnablePacketDumps

        public static boolean sEnablePacketDumps
        When true, sEnablePacketDumps will cause packet data contents to be written to the debug log in hexadecimal format. This is useful for debugging but should be disabled for production builds. The default is disabled (false).

      • kApplicationSize

        public static final int kApplicationSize
        kApplicationSize is the maximum number of bytes that may be written to the application flash region. Attempting to write more than this size will cause an exception. Currently the application region supports a maximum data size of 512KB
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • kResourceSize

        public static final int kResourceSize
        kResourceSize is the maximum number of bytes that may be written to the resource flash region. Attempting to write more than this size will cause an exception. Currently the resource region supports a maximum data size of 1280KB
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • LightX

        public LightX(ModuleId sourceModuleId,
              LightX.Delegate delegate,
              Socket socket)
       throws IOException
        Instantiate a LightX object.
        Parameters:
        sourceModuleId - The source ModuleId (probably one of ModuleId.Bluetooth or ModuleId.USB)
        delegate - The receiver of LightX.Delegate messages. This parameter cannot be null.
        socket - A socket opened for reading and writing. Note that this need not be backed by an actual socket, merely an object that conforms to the com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset.Socket protocol (such as an Android BluetoothSocket wrapped in a BluetoothSocketWrapper). This parameter cannot be null.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown when getInputStream() or getOutputStream() fails for socket

    • Method Detail

      • getSocket

        public Socket getSocket()
        Returns the socket passed to the LightX constructor
        Returns:
        the socket passed to the LightX constructor

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the socket passed to the LightX constructor and releases resources. Once close() is called this LightX instance is invalid and cannot be reused.

      • enterApplication

        public void enterApplication()
        When in bootloader mode, issue enterApplication() to jump back to application mode.

      • enterBootloader

        public void enterBootloader()
        When in application mode, issue enterBootloader() to jump back to bootloader mode.

      • readApp

        public void readApp(Command command)
        A convenience method that calls readApp( command, timeoutMs ) with the default timeout of 250ms
        Parameters:
        command - The application read command to issue. Must be within the range Command.AppFirst <= command <= Command.AppLast. Note that not all commands may be implemented by the application firmware.

      • readApp

        public void readApp(Command command,
                    int timeoutMs)
        readApp() requests an application parameter from the LightX hardware. When complete, the value of the read parameter will be returned via the delegate's lightXReadApp() callback.
        Parameters:
        command - The application read command to issue. Must be within the range Command.AppFirst <= command <= Command.AppLast. Note that not all commands may be implemented by the application firmware.
        timeoutMs - The timeout in milliseconds to wait before retransmitting the write request. Generally this value should be >= 250.

      • readFirmware

        public void readFirmware(LightX.FirmwareRegion region,
                         int from,
                         int to)
        readFirmware() allows the caller to read bytes from the application or resource region. Data is returned via the lightXFirmwareReadStatus() delegate callback.
        Parameters:
        region - The LightX firmware region (application or resource) to write to
        from - The offset in bytes from the start of the region to begin reading
        to - The offset in bytes from the start of the region to read to stop reading (exclusive)

      • writeApp

        public void writeApp(Command command,
                     byte[] buffer)
        A convenience method that calls 
        writeApp( command, buffer, timeoutMs )
        with the default timeout of 250ms.
        Parameters:
        command - The application write command to issue. Must be within the range Command.AppFirst <= command <= Command.AppLast. Note that not all commands may be implemented by the application firmware.
        buffer - The buffer to write to include with the command packet. Buffer contents are implementation dependent.

      • writeApp

        public void writeApp(Command command,
                     byte[] buffer,
                     int timeoutMs)
        writeApp() writes an application parameter to the LightX hardware. When complete, success or failure will be returned to the delegate via the lightXWriteApp() callback.
        Parameters:
        command - The application write command to issue. Must be within the range Command.AppFirst <= command <= Command.AppLast. Note that not all commands may be implemented by the application firmware.
        timeoutMs - The timeout in milliseconds to wait before retransmitting the write request. Generally this value should be >= 250.
        buffer - The buffer to write to include with the command packet. Buffer contents are implementation dependent.

      • writeAppWithBooleanArgument

        public void writeAppWithBooleanArgument(Command command,
                                        boolean argument,
                                        int timeoutMs)
        Issue an app-command request to the LightX hardware with a boolean argument. When the hardware responds the LightX delegate's lightXWriteResult() callback will be called to acknowledge success or failure.
        Parameters:
        command - The Command.App* command to send to the LightX hardware.
        argument - The boolean argument to send with the command.
        timeoutMs - The timeout in milliseconds to wait before retransmitting the write request. Generally this value should be >= 250.

      • writeAppWithBooleanArgument

        public void writeAppWithBooleanArgument(Command command,
                                        boolean argument)
        Issue an app-command request to the LightX hardware with a boolean argument. When the hardware responds the LightX delegate's lightXWriteResult() callback will be called to acknowledge success or failure. This command uses the default timeout value of 250ms.
        Parameters:
        command - The Command.App* command to send to the LightX hardware.
        argument - The boolean argument to send with the command.

      • writeAppWithFloatArgument

        public void writeAppWithFloatArgument(Command command,
                                      float argument,
                                      int timeoutMs)
        Issue an app-command request to the LightX hardware with a float argument. When the hardware responds the LightX delegate's lightXWriteResult() callback will be called to acknowledge success or failure.
        Parameters:
        command - The Command.App* command to send to the LightX hardware.
        argument - The float argument to send with the command.
        timeoutMs - The timeout in milliseconds to wait before retransmitting the write request. Generally this value should be >= 250.

      • writeAppWithUInt32Argument

        public void writeAppWithUInt32Argument(Command command,
                                       long argument)
        Issue an app-command request to the LightX hardware with a UInt32 argument. When the hardware responds the LightX delegate's lightXWriteResult() callback will be called to acknowledge success or failure.
        Parameters:
        command - The Command.App* command to send to the LightX hardware.
        argument - The UInt32 argument to send with the command (argument will be ANDed with 0xFFFFFFFFL)

      • writeAppWithUInt32Arguments

        public void writeAppWithUInt32Arguments(Command command,
                                        long[] arguments)
        A convenience method that calls 
        writeAppWithUInt32Arguments( Command command, long[] arguments, int timeoutMs )
        with the default timeout of 250ms.
        Parameters:
        command - The Command.App* command to send to the LightX hardware.
        arguments - The UInt32 arguments to send with the command (each argument will be ANDed with 0xFFFFFFFFL)

      • writeAppWithUInt32Arguments

        public void writeAppWithUInt32Arguments(Command command,
                                        long[] arguments,
                                        int timeoutMs)
        Issue an app-command request to the LightX hardware with one or more UInt32 arguments. When the hardware responds the LightX delegate's lightXWriteResult() callback will be called to acknowledge success or failure.
        Parameters:
        command - The Command.App* command to send to the LightX hardware.
        arguments - The UInt32 arguments to send with the command (each argument will be ANDed with 0xFFFFFFFFL)
        timeoutMs - The timeout in milliseconds to wait for a reply. If no reply is received within this window, the LightX delegate's lightXWillRetransmit() method will be called to request permission to continue with the command.

      • writeAppANCAwarenessPreset

        public void writeAppANCAwarenessPreset(ANCAwarenessPreset preset)

      • writeAppOnEarDetectionWithAutoOff

        public void writeAppOnEarDetectionWithAutoOff(boolean enable)
        writeAppOnEarDetectionWithAutoOff() enables or disables headphone proximity sensing and auto-off behavior when enabled.
        Parameters:
        enable - If true, headphone proximity detection is enabled and when the hardware detects that the headphone has been removed for a period of time the headphones will automatically power off. Otherwise this feature is disabled.

        public void writeAppVoicePromptEnable(boolean enable)

      • writeFirmware

        public void writeFirmware(LightX.FirmwareRegion region,
                          byte[] data)
        writeFirmware() allows the caller to write data into the firmware's application or resource region. The LightX delegate's lightXFirmwareWriteStatus() method will be called back repeatedly with progress and status information (see the lightXFirmwareWriteStatus() documentation for further detail). Authentication is required.
        Parameters:
        region - The LightX firmware region (application or resource) to write to
        data - The data to write to the selected region
